topic: Pie Chart - Sales & Revenue Analysis of Electronic Goods in 2023

data_source.title: Market Share of Electronic Brands in 2023

questions.question: What is the total number of units sold by Brand Y?
questions.explanation: Brand Y has a 25% share of total sales. Total units = 2000,000. So, 25% of 2000,000 = 500,000 units.

questions.question: Which brand has the second highest market share?
questions.explanation: Brand Y has the second highest market share at 25%, just after Brand X, which has 30%.

questions.question: What is the difference in the number of units sold between Brand X and Brand Z?
questions.explanation: Brand X sold 600,000 units and Brand Z sold 400,000 units. The difference is 600,000 - 400,000 = 200,000 units.

questions.question: What percentage of total sales is contributed by Brand W?
questions.explanation: Brand W contributes 15% to the total sales as indicated in the pie chart.

questions.question: If the total sales increase by 10% next year, how many units would Brand X sell, assuming its market share remains the same?
questions.explanation: Next year's total units = 2000,000 * 110% = 2200,000. Brand X's share = 30% of 2200,000 = 660,000 units.

data_source.title: Distribution of Bank Loans by Sector in 2023

questions.question: What is the amount of loans given to the Agriculture sector?
questions.explanation: The Agriculture sector received 25% of the total loans. Total loans are 20,000 million, so 25% of 20,000 million is 5,000 million.

questions.question: What is the percentage of loans given to the Services sector compared to the Manufacturing sector?
questions.explanation: Loans to Services are 4,000 million and to Manufacturing are 6,000 million. The percentage is (4,000 / 6,000) x 100% = 66.67%.

questions.question: If the total loans increase by 10% next year, what will be the new amount for the Retail sector assuming its percentage share remains the same?
questions.explanation: New total loans = 20,000 million + 10% of 20,000 million = 22,000 million. Retail sector receives 15% of 22,000 million = 3,300 million.

questions.question: Which sector received the least amount of loans, and by how much is it less than the Agriculture sector?
questions.explanation: The Others sector received 2,000 million, which is the least. Agriculture received 5,000 million, so the difference is 5,000 - 2,000 = 3,000 million.

questions.question: If the percentage of loans to Manufacturing increases by 5% next year while total loans remain the same, what will be the new amount allocated to Manufacturing?
questions.explanation: New percentage for Manufacturing = 30% + 5% = 35%. The new amount = 35% of 20,000 million = 7,000 million.

topic: Pie Chart - Population & Demographics in Metro City

data_source.title: Population Distribution by Age Group in Metro City (in thousands)

questions.question: What is the exact population of Youth in Metro City?
questions.explanation: The Youth segment represents 18% of the total population. Calculation: 18% of 1,000,000 = 180,000.

questions.question: What is the ratio of Adults to Children?
questions.explanation: Adults population is 400,000 and Children population is 200,000. Ratio = 400,000:200,000 = 4:1.

questions.question: What percentage of the total population is either Seniors or Elderly?
questions.explanation: Seniors (12%) + Elderly (10%) = 22%. Thus, 22% of the population is either Seniors or Elderly.

questions.question: By how much does the Adult population exceed the combined population of Seniors and Elderly?
questions.explanation: Adults: 400,000. Seniors + Elderly: 220,000. Difference = 400,000 - 220,000 = 180,000.

questions.question: If the total population increases by 10%, what will be the new population of the Elderly?

topic: Pie Chart - Production & Manufacturing Market Share

data_source.title: Market Share of Automobile Manufacturers in 2023

questions.question: What is the absolute difference in units produced between Manufacturer A and Manufacturer C?
questions.explanation: Manufacturer A produced 4500 units, while Manufacturer C produced 3000 units. The absolute difference is 4500 - 3000 = 1500 units.

questions.question: What percentage of the total production is accounted for by Manufacturer B and Manufacturer D together?
questions.explanation: Manufacturer B accounts for 25% and Manufacturer D for 15%. Together, they account for 25% + 15% = 40% of the total production.

questions.question: If Manufacturer E increases its production by 20% next year while others remain constant, what will be its new market share percentage?
questions.explanation: Manufacturer E's current production is 1500. A 20% increase makes it 1500 * 1.2 = 1800. Total production becomes 15000 + 300 = 15300. New market share = (1800/15300) * 100 = 11.76%.

questions.question: Assuming a linear growth, what is the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) if Manufacturer C's production grows to 3900 units over two years?
questions.explanation: Initial production: 3000 units, Final production: 3900 units, Time: 2 years. CAGR = [(3900/3000)^(1/2) - 1] * 100 = [1.3^(0.5) - 1] * 100 = 15.0%.

questions.question: What is the ratio of units produced by Manufacturer A to the combined units of Manufacturer B and Manufacturer E?
questions.explanation: Manufacturer A produced 4500 units. Manufacturer B and E combined produced 3750 + 1500 = 5250 units. The ratio is 4500:5250, which simplifies to 6:5.

topic: Pie Chart - Import & Export Analysis of Country X in 2023

data_source.title: Import & Export Distribution of Country X in 2023

questions.question: What is the absolute difference in value between the Machinery and Minerals segments?
questions.explanation: Machinery value = 500 Million USD, Minerals value = 300 Million USD. Difference = 500 - 300 = 200 Million USD.

questions.question: What percentage of the total imports and exports is represented by the Chemicals and Textiles segments combined?
questions.explanation: Chemicals percentage = 30%, Textiles percentage = 10%. Combined = 30% + 10% = 40%.

questions.question: If the value of Agricultural Products increases by 10% next year, what will be the new value?
questions.explanation: Original value of Agricultural Products = 400 Million USD. Increase = 10% of 400 = 40 Million USD. New value = 400 + 40 = 440 Million USD.

questions.question: What is the ratio of the value of Machinery to Chemicals?
questions.explanation: Value of Machinery = 500 Million USD, Value of Chemicals = 600 Million USD. Ratio = 500:600 = 5:6.

questions.question: If the total imports and exports grow by 10% next year, but the percentage distribution remains the same, what will be the new value of the Minerals segment?
questions.explanation: Total grows by 10%, so new total = 2000 * 1.10 = 2200 Million USD. Minerals percentage = 15%, so new value = 15% of 2200 = 330 Million USD.
